DOC.brief_title: Comparative Study Reconstituted JUVÉDERM® Ultra v COSMODERM® 1 Lip Cheek Lines , Folds Wrinkles
DOC.detailed_description: This single center , prospective , open label , randomize , comparative , split-face study adult female male age 25 70 year seek treatment reconstitute Juvéderm® Ultra CosmoDerm® 1 human-based collagen implant moderate severe vertical lip rhytids and/or radial cheek line .
DOC.criteria: Adult female male , age 25 70 year ; Subjects must seek treatment Juvéderm Ultra CosmoDerm 1 injection vertical lip rhytids radial cheek line ; Subjects must one moderate severe vertical lip rhytids and/or moderate severe radial cheek line base physician evaluator assessment ( 03 scale ) ; Women must either nonchildbearing potential ( i.e. , surgically sterilize postmenopausal ) childbearing potential , must pregnant ( document negative urine pregnancy test baseline examination ) lactating must practice medically acceptable method birth control ; Subjects must willing able provide write informed consent ; Subjects must willing able follow procedure outline protocol . Female subject pregnant ( positive urine pregnancy test ) infant breastfeed childbearing potential practicing reliable method birth control ; Previous Botox treatment low twothirds face within past 6 month subject injection radial cheek line . Note : exclusion criterion apply subject injection lip rhytids unless previous Botox treatment administer within past 6 month upper lip region ; Previous semipermanent injectable filler therapy midlower face within past year prior history permanent filler therapy injection midlower face ; Prior cosmetic procedure ( i.e. , facelift , etc . ) visible scar may affect evaluation response and/or quality photography opinion investigator ; Known allergy sensitivity treatment injection component , include know suspected lidocaine hypersensitivity ; Known severe allergy manifest history anaphylaxis history presence multiple severe allergy ; Subjects infection injection site systemic infection ( case , postpone study entry one week follow recovery ) ; Subjects require treatment major anticoagulant ( Coumadin ) antiplatelets ( Plavix ) study ; lowdose aspirin treatment antiinflammatory medication potential anticoagulant antiplatelet effect may allow investigator 's discretion ; Concurrent participation investigational drug device study participation within 30 day study start ; Subjects undergo additional cosmetic procedure study period ; Subjects change use facial product 6 month prior enrollment study period ; Subjects history poor cooperation , noncompliance medical treatment , unreliability .
